question: Which of the following is the most likely cause of perforation of the bony part of the nasal septum?
Which of the following is the most common presentation of nasopharyngeal cancer?
A 9-year-old boy had gotten into a fight 4 days ago. He has now developed bilateral nasal obstruction with pain and fever. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old woman presents to the office with the complaint of nasal obstruction. Examination reveals a foul smell from the nose as well as roomy nasal cavities with greenish crusts. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old male presents to your office with the complaint of watery rhinorrhea on bending his head. He had an operation for deviated nasal septum 4 months ago. Anterior rhinoscopy does not reveal any remarkable findings. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 5-year-old child presents to the office with a history of recurrent epistaxis. What is the most probable cause of epistaxis in this age group?
A farmer develops long-standing late-stage atrophic rhinitis. Which of the following treatments is most preferable to eradicate the disease?

A 2-year-old child is brought to the emergency department with complaints of nasal obstruction, epistaxis, and rhinorrhea. Examination reveals watch glass swelling of the nasal septum. Recent history is positive for the child falling from a bed. What is the most likely diagnosis? (CBL)

A shopkeeper comes to an otorhinolaryngologist and is diagnosed with chronic sinusitis. The diagnosis was made after doing a nasal endoscopy. Which of the following is the confirmatory sign for establishing this diagnosis?

A middle-aged woman has developed long-standing purulent secretion in her maxillary sinus. An antral washout is planned. What should be the direction of the trocar and cannula while performing this procedure?
A farmer has developed a granuloma in his nose. Biopsy and histopathology of the granuloma reveal epitheliod necrotizing granuloma and vasculitis. Which of the following diseases has these features?
A 50-year-old man with a history of hypertension suddenly develops heavy bleeding from his nose. Which emergency measure will be beneficial for him?

answers.option: Cold sponging and pinching the nose

question: Which of the following fractures is associated with craniofacial dissociation?
A 17-year-old male presents to the emergency department with the complaint of bleeding from the nose after suffering a trauma. Which of the following is the most common site of epistaxis?
Which of the following facial fractures is characterized by step deformity of the infraorbital margin?

A 40-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a complaint of watery rhinorrhea on bending forward. He was in a road traffic accident 6 months ago. Examination reveals a scar mark on the bridge of the nose with boggy nasal mucosa. He is suspected to have CSF rhinorrhea. Which test would confirm this diagnosis?
Which of the following is the site of the antral lavage or proof puncture?

A 17-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for the evaluation of recurrent epistaxis and nasal obstruction. Examination reveals a lobulated mass obstructing the left concha. Which of the following is the investigation of choice for this condition?

answers.option: Soft tissue lateral radiograph of nasopharynx
CT scan of the head with contrast

question: Which of the following structures forms part of the nasal septum?
Which of the following surgical approaches is used to reach the frontal sinus in chronic sinusitis?

A neonate of one day of age has recurrent cyanosis and breathing difficulty. A mucoid discharge is noted inside the nasal cavity. Doctors suspect an upper respiratory tract infection, but there is no stridor or fever. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A middle-aged man works in a nickel refining factory. Which lethal condition might develop in his nasal or paranasal sinuses?

A school van driver presents to the clinic with a 4-month history of paroxysmal sneezing, runny nose, and watery eyes, precipitated by smoke and dust. A diagnosis of allergic rhinitis is made. Which antihistamine would be best for him?

A 13-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with complaints of profuse and fresh red epistaxis for the past 1 year, decreased hearing, and a bulging cheek. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A middle-aged man is found to have developed an inverted papilloma in his right nasal cavity. Which of the following has traditionally been the treatment of choice for inverted papillomas?
A 50-year-old man is diagnosed with early-stage squamous cell carcinoma of the nose and sinuses. Which of the following is the most common site for the origination of this malignancy?

A 21-year-old female, who had been in a road traffic accident 4 days ago, presents to the outpatient department with complaints of persistent swelling, bilateral nasal obstruction, and pain. Examination reveals a bulge on both sides of the nasal septum. Her temperature is 100.5 F. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old female presents to the emergency department with severely painful nose swelling, malaise, and fever. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
How much is the fluid capacity of a frontal sinus?
Which of the following is correct regarding antrochoanal polypi?
A 16-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for the evaluation of recurrent, bilateral profuse epistaxis and nasal obstruction. There is no history of recent trauma. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is true regarding sinonasal polyps?

answers.option: Ethmoidal polyp are common in children
Ethmoidal polyp are multiple and bilateral
Allergy may cause an antrochoanal polyp
Caldwell-Luc's operation is used to treat them

question: Which of the following is the gold standard investigation for detecting the site of defect in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) rhinorrhea?
Which of the following instruments can be used for the removal of a foreign body from the nose?
At what age can the frontal sinuses be identified on a radiograph?
Which of the following artery is known as the artery of epistaxis?
Which of the following causes Frey syndrome?
Which of the following surgical approaches is used to reach the maxillary sinus in chronic sinusitis?
What is the treatment of choice for nasopharyngeal angiofibroma?
Which of the following is a severe complication of submucous resection of the nasal septum?
Which of the following is a cosmetic complication of submucous resection surgery?
Which of the following is the most common malignant neoplasm of the external nose?
Which of the following is the most appropriate step in the management of allergic rhinitis?
Which of the following tests is done to confirm allergic rhinitis?

A 35-year-old female presents with deep orbital pain and frontal headache. There is also a history of long-standing chronic sinusitis. On cranial nerve examination, there is palsy of cranial nerves 6, 3, and 4. The vision is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the best treatment for nasopharyngeal carcinoma (stage III)?

A 3-year-old boy was brought with the complaint of unilateral foul-smelling and blood-stained discharge from the nose for the last two weeks. What is the most important condition that should be suspected first?

A 17-year-old boy presented with nasal obstruction, left cheek swelling, and epistaxis. Lateral X-ray nasopharynx is the showing anterior bowing of the posterior maxillary wall. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 25-year-old boxer was brought to the emergency room with a history of forceful punch by his opponent on the right side of his nose one and a half hours ago. On nasal examination, external deformity with the left deflected nose is visible. On anterior rhinoscopy left-sided deviated nasal septum without active bleeding is present. How will you manage this patient?

A 12-year-old boy presented with a pre-auricular sinus on the right side with a history of recurrent infection in it. At the time of presentation, it was not infected. What should be the further management?

answers.option: Regular suction cleaning of the sinus
Regular follow-up till the age of 18 years

question: A 31-year-old male underwent endoscopic nasal surgery for bilateral nasal polyps. Post-surgery: he started to have clear rhinorrhea which came in drops especially on stooping forward. What is the most likely area which may have been traumatized during surgery?

answers.option: Trauma to perpendicular plate of ethmoid bone
Trauma to cribriform plate of ethmoid bone

question: A 17-year-old girl, who has a history of asthma and chronic allergic rhinitis presents with a 1-month history of persistent nasal congestion, rhinorrhoea, and headache. Her routine home medications include albuterol, nasal corticosteroids, and antihistamines. The physician decided to start a topical nasal decongestant that acts as an alpha-receptor agonist. Which of the following agents can be used as a nasal decongestant that acts on alpha receptor?
What will be the most prominent examination finding in a patient with chronic sinusitis?

answers.option: Mucous on floor of nasal cavity

question: A 66-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of nasal obstruction for 6 months. He has a history of a surgical procedure carried out for a nasal mass previously. On examination, there is a pale fleshy polypoidal mass in the nasal cavity. There are no nodes palpable. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the best investigation for Wegener granulomatosis?

A 65-year-old female is referred from the urology department concerning her headache and nasal congestion. She has a medical history of uncontrolled diabetes and chronic kidney disease. On examination, there is a black mass seen in the nose and sinuses. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 30-year-old male comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of frontal headache and deviated nasal septum. What is the most appropriate investigation at this time?
What is the common risk factor in allergic rhinitis?
What is the common etiological factor of epistaxis in old-aged people?
Which one of the following is a cause of Rhinolalia Aperta?
What is the cause of bilateral nasal obstruction and septal bulge, following nasal trauma?
A 12-year-old presents in outpatient with a complaint of unilateral foul-smelling nasal discharge. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following can frequently be caused by blow from the front to the nose?
Which one of the following is the most commonly implicated etiology of nasal polyps?

A 33-year-old male patient presents to the outpatient clinic complaining of a watery discharge from the nostrils on bending forwards. He recently underwent submucosal resection surgery for deviated nasal septum. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following tests is used to check for the patency of nasal valves?
Which of the following is a specific test used to diagnose allergic rhinitis?
Which of the following is the most common complication of submucosal resection (SMR) operation?
A 23-year-old male is treated in the hospital for a septal abscess that he developed after a submucosal resection operation. What other complication he is at risk of developing?
Which of the following is the best imaging modality for the diagnosis of nasopharyngeal angiofibroma?

answers.option: Computed tomography scan with contrast enhancement

question: A 20-year-old male patient presents with a rapidly enlarging mass around the left maxillary region for 3 months. On imaging, a ground glass mass surrounding the maxillary sinus is seen. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with profuse bleeding from the nose and mouth. Anterior nasal packing is done to stop the bleeding but it does not stop the bleeding. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Posterior nasal packing with anterior packing
Endoscopic ligation of external carotid artery

question: A 9-year-old boy started bleeding from his nose while exercising in school. Which first aid measure will be beneficial in this case?

answers.option: Inserting cotton balls in his nostrils
Sitting upright with forward leaning and pinching the nose
Asking him to lie down with ice packing
Backward leaning and pinching the nose
Taking him to hospital in a car

question: A patient presents with a history of runny nose, sneezing, and nasal obstruction. On examination, there are multiple grey glistening masses in both nostrils. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following instruments can be used to remove a foreign body from the nose?

A 35-year-old male presents to the clinic with bilateral nasal swelling. On examination, the skin appears to be hyperemic, and the swelling is tender. He also gives a history of frequent nose-picking. What is the most likely causative organism?
What is the most important etiological factor for acute sinusitis?
Which approach is used nowadays for maxillary sinus surgery?
Which of the following is an etiological factor for nasopharyngeal carcinoma?
Which of the following is the best treatment for anterior spur deviated nasal septum?
Which of the following correctly identifies a paranasal sinus that will be radiologically visible at the given time?

answers.option: Frontal sinus at 6 months of age
Sphenoid sinus at 1 year of age
Ethmoid sinus at 8 months of age
Maxillary sinus at 6 months of age
Frontal sinus at 2 years of age

question: What is the most common cause of perforation of nasal septum?

answers.option: Prolonged use of steroids for nasal allergy

question: A 45-year-old male patient presented to the ENT outpatient department with a history of clear fluid coming from the nose. The discharge is continuous, can not be sniffed back and there is a history of head injury 2 weeks back. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A patient with known history of diabetes presented to the clinic with the complaint of foul-smelling discharge from the nose. Crusting and black mass was seen on examination. What would be the most probable diagnosis?
